energy-rl.title: Energy-Aware Language-Conditioned Manipulation
energy-rl.mission: Optimize task success vs. mechanical energy consumption using semantic modulation.
energy-rl.problem: Traditional RL agents prioritize success at the cost of physical integrity, often 'cheating' by slamming joints to open doors. This leads to high torque spikes and jerky trajectories that damage hardware in real-world deployments.
energy-rl.solution: Implemented an Energy-Aware Constraint Optimization (ECO) framework using SAC and Sentence-BERT. By mapping commands like 'gently' to strict energy budgets via Lagrangian multipliers, the system achieves a diverse Pareto frontier of behaviors.

pivots.title: Reward Grounding
pivots.description: Shifted from pure goal-based rewards to tactile-grounded rewards using MuJoCo contact sensors to ensure physical interaction was intentional and safe.

plots.caption: Pareto Frontier: Success Rate vs. Energy for different language conditions.

multi-agent-rl.title: MAS Drone Coordination (MAPPO vs IPPO)
multi-agent-rl.mission: Cooperative formation flying using coordinated multi-agent reinforcement learning.
multi-agent-rl.problem: Independent agents (IPPO) diverge in 'coupled' tasks (e.g., spirals) because the environment becomes non-stationary as other agents learn. Absolute coordinates also introduce 'Origin Bias' that breaks generalization.
multi-agent-rl.solution: Implemented a Custom MAPPO framework with CTDE (Centralized Training, Decentralized Execution) and Relative Coordinate Encoding. Optimized O(N) scaling for the centralized critic to manage Joint-State (N x 12) inputs without performance lag.

pivots.title: Origin-Agnostic Learning
pivots.description: Switched from absolute to relative coordinate frames. This pivot eliminated the 'Origin Bias', allowing drones to coordinate based on proximity rather than their starting positions.

plots.caption: Spiral Formation Tracking: Comparing Custom MAPPO against Stable-Baselines3 (SB3).

cfd-uav.title: CFD-Informed Robust Drone Navigation
cfd-uav.mission: Enable robust multi-rotor navigation through turbulent, wind-heavy environments.
cfd-uav.problem: Unpredictable wind disturbances in cluttered environments cause high tracking errors (RMSE) and mission failure. Standard planners ignore the aerodynamic cost of navigating through turbulent 'hotspots'.
cfd-uav.solution: Developed a hybrid Beziér–A* global planner using FluidX3D CFD wind-field data and NeuroMHE (Neural Moving Horizon Estimation) for adaptive control. The system identifies 'wind-shielded' zones and optimizes trajectories for aerodynamic stability across -35 to 35 wind contexts.

pivots.title: Contextual Adaptive Control
pivots.description: Pivoted from static wind models to a Neural MHE approach that classifies wind 'contexts' in real-time, allowing the drone to switch control policies as it enters turbulent lee-side zones.

plots.caption: CFD Wind Field Analysis (FluidX3D): Identifying laminar flow zones for stable navigation.

kalman-tracking.title: Robust Kalman Filter for Object Tracking
kalman-tracking.mission: Precise pose estimation of moving targets under high sensor noise and visual outliers.
kalman-tracking.problem: AprilTag tracking in dynamic scenes often suffers from 'jumpy' results due to partial occlusions. Standard Kalman Filters are sensitive to these outliers, causing erratic and unreliable state estimates.
kalman-tracking.solution: Implemented a Robust Kalman Filter using incremental Expectation-Maximization (EM) to learn outlier distributions online. The system dynamically weights measurements, 'distrusting' noisy spikes while maintaining sub-5ms inference on Raspberry Pi.

pivots.title: EM Online Learning
pivots.description: Initially used static noise models which failed in variable lighting. Implemented online parameter learning to adapt to changing track quality in real-time.

plots.caption: Robust Kalman Filter: Estimated x y z plotted against time and raw data

telemetry-bms.title: Distributed Telemetry & Remote BMS Gateway
telemetry-bms.mission: Monitor and control large-scale electric vehicle fleets with 24/7 reliability across diverse client requirements.
telemetry-bms.problem: Collecting cell-level battery data across cellular networks requires massive bandwidth, and serving diverse clients (fleet operators, BMS vendors, EV OEMs) means the firmware must simultaneously support keyless vehicle security, real-time driving analytics, OBD data extraction, and OTA management — all on a single constrained MCU with deterministic timing guarantees.
telemetry-bms.solution: Architected bare-metal C/C++ firmware on Renesas RA2L1 (ARM Cortex-M23), implementing low-level system drivers for UART, SPI, I2C, and CAN with optimal memory layout. Integrated IMU and GNSS sensors validated through field testing on live vehicles. Delivered a 2.6x lossless edge-compression algorithm and edge computing for battery health monitoring and charging/discharging control. OTA firmware and BMS configuration updates over CAN (ISO-TP), co-existing with real-time driving alert generation (harsh acceleration, harsh braking, over-speeding) and Bluetooth-based mobilization/immobilization commands.

pivots.title: Fault-Tolerant OTA
pivots.description: Implemented persistent flash buffers and a safety-first rollback mechanism to ensure zero bricking even during cellular signal drops — critical for remote fleet management at 5000+ unit scale.

pivots.title: Protocol Versatility
pivots.description: A single TCU firmware had to speak multiple industrial dialects: CAN J1939 OBD collection, ISO-TP framed BMS updates, RS-485 (MODBUS) for energy meter data, AIS-140 government compliance, and Protobuf + Base64 encoding for bandwidth-efficient MQTT telemetry. Each integration required careful buffer management to avoid priority inversion on the shared UART/CAN peripherals.
